statement:
If $X$ and $Y$ have the same elements, then $X = Y$.

The Axiom of Extensionality is one of the axioms of Zermelo-Fraenkel set
theory. In symbols, it reads:
$$\forall u(u \in X \leftrightarrow u \in Y) \rightarrow X = Y.$$ Note
that the converse,
$$X = Y \rightarrow \forall u(u \in X \leftrightarrow u \in Y)$$ is an
axiom of the predicate calculus. Hence we have,
$$X = Y \leftrightarrow \forall u(u \in X \leftrightarrow u \in Y).$$
Therefore the Axiom of Extensionality expresses the most fundamental
notion of a set: a set is determined by its elements.
